00022 #define __MEMORYGUARD_C
00023 #include "memoryguard.h"
00024 
00025 #ifdef ENABLE_MEMORY_GUARD // set in memory guard.h
00026 #include <stdlib.h>
00027 #include <time.h>
00028 #include <errno.h>
00029 #include <stdio.h>
00030 #include <pthread.h>
00031 
00032 /********************************************************************/
00033 
00034 /* @name Types
00035  *
00036  */
00037 
00038 /* @struct mmg_entry
00039  * @brief  descriptor of memory segments
00040  */
00041 struct mmg_entry {
00043   struct mmg_entry *pNext;
00045   struct mmg_entry *pPrev;
00047   void* p;
00049   int iSize;
00051   int iAllocated;
00053   const char* file;
00055   int lineno;
00057   time_t ts;
00058 };
00059 
00060 
00061 /********************************************************************/
00062 
00063 /* @name Global variables
00064  *
00065  */
00066 
00067 /* @def   MMG_INITIAL_LIST_SIZE
00068  * @brief size of the initial table entires allocated in the program heap
00069  */ 
00070 #define MMG_INITIAL_LIST_SIZE 100
00071 /* @global g_mmg_fixed
00072  * @brief the initial elements of the mmg list are allocated in the program heap
00073  */
00074 struct mmg_entry g_mmg_fixed[MMG_INITIAL_LIST_SIZE];
00075 /* @global g_AnchorFree
00076  * @brief anchor of the list of free entries
00077  */
00078 struct mmg_entry g_AnchorFree;
00079 /* @global g_AnchorActive
00080  * @brief anchor of the list of active entries
00081  */
00082 struct mmg_entry g_AnchorActive;
00083 /* @global g_nofAllocated
00084  * @brief  the number of curently allocated blocks
00085  */
00086 int    g_nofAllocated=0;
00087 /* @global g_maxAllocated
00088  * @brief  the maximum count of allocated blocks
00089  */
00090 int    g_maxAllocated=0;
00091 /* @global g_nofAllocations
00092  * @brief  the total number of allocations
00093  */
00094 int    g_nofAllocations=0;
00095 /* @global g_fpLog
00096  * @brief  log file instance
00097  */
00098 FILE* g_fpLog=NULL;
00099 /* @global g_logLevel
00100  * @brief global logging level of the memory guard
00101  */
00102 int g_logLevel=0;
00103 /* @global mutex
00104  * @brief  mutex for protection of the table operations
00105  */
00106 pthread_mutex_t mutex = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
00107 
00108 /********************************************************************/
00109 
00110 /* @name Logging macros
00111  */
00112 
00113 /* @def mmg_debug
00114  */
00115 #define mmg_debug(format, ...)   if (g_logLevel<=kmmg_debug)   fprintf(g_fpLog==NULL?stderr:g_fpLog, "mmg debug: "   format, ##__VA_ARGS__);
00116 /* @def mmg_info
00117  */
00118 #define mmg_info(format, ...)    if (g_logLevel<=kmmg_info )   fprintf(g_fpLog==NULL?stderr:g_fpLog, "mmg info: "    format, ##__VA_ARGS__);
00119 /* @def mmg_warning
00120  */
00121 #define mmg_warning(format, ...) if (g_logLevel<=kmmg_warning) fprintf(g_fpLog==NULL?stderr:g_fpLog, "mmg warning: " format, ##__VA_ARGS__);
00122 /* @def mmg_error
00123  */
00124 #define mmg_error(format, ...)   if (g_logLevel<=kmmg_error)   fprintf(g_fpLog==NULL?stderr:g_fpLog, "mmg error: "   format, ##__VA_ARGS__);
00125 
00126 /********************************************************************/
00127  
00128 /* insert an element into the list
00129  * @param pPrev    the element to insert after  
00130  * @param pElement the element to insert
00131  */
00132 int mmg_insert(struct mmg_entry* pPrev, struct mmg_entry* pElement) 
00133 {
00134   int iResult=0;
00135   if (pPrev && pElement) {
00136     pthread_mutex_lock(&mutex);
00137     pElement->pPrev=pPrev;
00138     pElement->pNext=pPrev->pNext;
00139     (pPrev->pNext)->pPrev=pElement;
00140     pPrev->pNext=pElement;
00141     pthread_mutex_unlock(&mutex);
00142   } else {
00143     iResult=-EINVAL;
00144   }
00145   return iResult;
00146 }
00147 
00148 /* remove entry from the list
00149  * the next and previous element will be changed
00150  * @param pElement the element to be removed
00151  */
00152 int mmg_remove(struct mmg_entry* pElement)
00153 {
00154   int iResult=0;
00155   if (pElement==NULL) return -EINVAL;
00156   if (pElement==&g_AnchorFree || pElement==&g_AnchorActive) {
00157     fprintf(stderr, "mmg error: can not remove anchor %p\n", pElement);
00158     return -ENOENT;
00159   }
00160   pthread_mutex_lock(&mutex);
00161   (pElement->pPrev)->pNext=pElement->pNext;
00162   (pElement->pNext)->pPrev=pElement->pPrev;
00163   pElement->pPrev=NULL;
00164   pElement->pNext=NULL;
00165   pthread_mutex_unlock(&mutex);
00166 
00167   return iResult;
00168 }
00169 
00170 struct mmg_entry* mmg_findpointer(void* p, struct mmg_entry* anchor)
00171 {
00172   struct mmg_entry* pEntry=NULL;
00173   if (anchor) {
00174     pEntry=anchor->pNext;
00175     while (pEntry!=anchor) {
00176       if (pEntry->p!=NULL && pEntry->p==p) break;
00177       pEntry=pEntry->pNext;
00178     }
00179     if (pEntry==anchor) pEntry=NULL;
00180   }
00181   return pEntry;
00182 }
00183 
00184 int mmg_init(const char* pLogFile, int iLogLevel)
00185 {
00186   int i=0;
00187   if (pLogFile) {
00188     g_fpLog=fopen(pLogFile ,"w");
00189     if (g_fpLog) {
00190       fprintf(g_fpLog, "start memory guard logging\n");
00191       time_t t;
00192       if (time(&t)>-1) {
00193     fprintf(g_fpLog, "%s", ctime(&t));
00194       }
00195     }
00196   }
00197   g_logLevel=iLogLevel;
00198   memset(g_mmg_fixed, 0, MMG_INITIAL_LIST_SIZE*sizeof(struct mmg_entry));
00199   memset(&g_AnchorFree, 0, sizeof(struct mmg_entry));
00200   g_AnchorFree.pNext=&g_AnchorFree;
00201   g_AnchorFree.pPrev=&g_AnchorFree;
00202   memset(&g_AnchorActive, 0, sizeof(struct mmg_entry));
00203   g_AnchorActive.pNext=&g_AnchorActive;
00204   g_AnchorActive.pPrev=&g_AnchorActive;
00205   struct mmg_entry *pPrev=&g_AnchorFree;
00206   for (; i<MMG_INITIAL_LIST_SIZE; i++) mmg_insert(pPrev, &(g_mmg_fixed[i]));
00207   mmg_debug("memory guard initialized with %d table entries, loglevel %d, logfile %s\n", MMG_INITIAL_LIST_SIZE, iLogLevel, pLogFile);
00208 }
00209 
00210 int mmg_exit()
00211 {
00212   // check if everthing has been released
00213   while (g_AnchorActive.pPrev!=&g_AnchorActive) {
00214     mmg_error("leftover memory: %p allocated %s at %s line %d\n", g_AnchorActive.pPrev->p, ctime(&(g_AnchorActive.pPrev->ts)), g_AnchorActive.pPrev->file, g_AnchorActive.pPrev->lineno);
00215     mmg_remove(g_AnchorActive.pPrev);
00216   }
00217   mmg_debug("memory guard exited:\n %d total allocations\n balance %d\n fill level %.2f%%\n", g_nofAllocations, g_nofAllocated, ((float)100*g_maxAllocated)/MMG_INITIAL_LIST_SIZE);
00218 }
00219 
00220 void* mmg_malloc(int size, const char* file, int lineno)
00221 {
00222   int allocate=size+strlen(PACKAGE_BUGREPORT)+1;
00223   void* p=malloc(allocate);
00224   if (p) {
00225     struct mmg_entry* pEntry=NULL;
00226     g_nofAllocations++;
00227     if (++g_nofAllocated>g_maxAllocated) g_maxAllocated=g_nofAllocated;
00228     if (g_AnchorFree.pPrev!=&g_AnchorFree) {
00229       pEntry=g_AnchorFree.pPrev;
00230       mmg_remove(pEntry);
00231     } else {
00232       // think about dynamic allocation
00233       // for now just flag that the array was exceeded
00234       if (g_maxAllocated==MMG_INITIAL_LIST_SIZE)
00235     mmg_warning("mmg_alloc: out of free entries\n");
00236     }
00237     if (pEntry) {
00238       pEntry->p=p;
00239       strcpy(p+size, PACKAGE_BUGREPORT);
00240       pEntry->iSize=size;
00241       pEntry->iAllocated=allocate;
00242       pEntry->file=file;
00243       pEntry->lineno=lineno;
00244       time(&(pEntry->ts));
00245       mmg_insert(&g_AnchorActive, pEntry);
00246       mmg_info("%s allocated %p (%d byte) at %s line %d\n", ctime(&(pEntry->ts)), pEntry->p, pEntry->iSize, file, lineno);
00247       mmg_debug(" -> descriptor %p\n", pEntry);
00248     }
00249   }
00250   return p;
00251 }
00252 
00253 void  mmg_free(void* p, const char* file, int lineno)
00254 {
00255   if (p) {
00256     if (g_nofAllocated>0) g_nofAllocated--;
00257     else mmg_warning("number missmatch in allocated and deallocated blocks\n");
00258     struct mmg_entry* pEntry=mmg_findpointer(p, &g_AnchorActive);
00259     if (pEntry) {
00260       mmg_debug("process \'free\' for descriptor %p\n", pEntry);
00261       time_t t;
00262       time(&t);
00263       mmg_info("%s free %p at %s line %d \n allocated %s at %s %d\n", ctime(&t), p, file, lineno, ctime(&(pEntry->ts)), pEntry->file, pEntry->lineno);
00264       if (pEntry->iSize<pEntry->iAllocated && strcmp((pEntry->p)+pEntry->iSize, PACKAGE_BUGREPORT)!=0) {
00265     mmg_error("!!!!!!!!!!!!! buffer overrun detected: %p !!!!!!!!!!!!\n allocated %s at %s line %d\n", pEntry->p, ctime(&(pEntry->ts)), pEntry->file, pEntry->lineno);
00266       }
00267       mmg_remove(pEntry);
00268       memset(pEntry, 0, sizeof(struct mmg_entry));
00269       mmg_insert(&g_AnchorFree, pEntry);
00270     } else {
00271       mmg_warning("mmg_free: can not find pointer %p\n", p);
00272     }
00273   }
00274   free(p);
00275 }
00276 
00277 #endif //ENABLE_MEMORY_GUARD
